edu.umass.cs.gnsserver.activecode.prototype.interfaces

Interface Querier

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ActiveQuerier

    public interface Querier
    This interface is used for active code to send back queries to GNS from its worker. It contains the following interfaces: readGuid writeGuid
    Author:
    gaozy

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ValuesMap readGuid(String queriedGuid, String field)
      This method allows customer's active code to read some other guid's value.
      void writeGuid(String queriedGuid, String field, ValuesMap value)
      This method allows customer's active code to update a field of some other guid.

    • Method Detail

      • readGuid

        ValuesMap readGuid(String queriedGuid,
                   String field)
            throws ActiveException
        This method allows customer's active code to read some other guid's value. It allows querierGuid to read the values from the fields of queriedGuid.

        Queried guid must be provided for ACL check. The implementation also needs to provide the querier guid. A user could query all fields by setting field to null, but it is not guaranteed that every read could get a value to return as the field may not exist or the read fails the ACL check for some field. GNS will return as many values as possible of fields being read from the queriedGuid, and put the values into the returned map object.

        To implement this method, a ttl value is also needed as the depth constrain may apply. But the ttl value should be provided by ActiveQuerier, but not user's code.

        Parameters:
        queriedGuid -
        field -
        Returns:
        the ValuesMap read from the field of the guid
        Throws:
        ActiveException - throws an exception if any parameter is null or response indicates the query fails

      • writeGuid

        void writeGuid(String queriedGuid,
               String field,
               ValuesMap value)
        throws ActiveException
        This method allows customer's active code to update a field of some other guid. It allows querierGuid to write value into a field of the queriedGuid.

        Queried guid and field must be provided for ACL check. GNS returns true if the write operation succeeds on the GNS side, otherwise it returns false.

        To implement this method, a ttl value is also needed as the depth constrain may apply. But the ttl value should be provided by ActiveQuerier, but not user's code.

        Parameters:
        queriedGuid -
        field -
        value -
        Throws:
        ActiveException - throws an exception if any parameter is null or response indicates the query fails
